section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Firm" means a proprietorship, partnership, or professional corporation engaged in the practice of public accountancy.
"Firm" includes an employee of the firm.
"Licensed certified public accountant" has the meaning stated in § 2-101(i) of the Business Occupations and Professions Article.
"Licensed certified public accountant" includes an employee of the licensed certified public accountant.
"Permit" has the meaning stated in § 2-101(j) of the Business Occupations and Professions Article.
"Practice of certified public accountancy" has the meaning stated for "practice certified public accountancy" in § 2-101(l) of the Business Occupations and Professions Article.

"Practice of public accountancy" means the performance or the offering to perform by a licensed certified public accountant or a firm, while holding out to the public, services for a client or a potential client that involve:
"Practice of public accountancy" includes the practice of certified public accountancy.

"Quality review" means an independent appraisal, review, or study of the professional work of a licensed certified public accountant or firm in the practice of public accountancy that is made by a licensed certified public accountant or firm that is not affiliated with the licensed certified public accountant or firm undergoing a quality review.

text.section:
Except as provided in subsections (c) and (d) of this section or unless expressly permitted by a client or the personal representative or successor in interest of the client, a licensed certified public accountant or firm may not disclose:
The contents of any communication made to the licensed certified public accountant or firm by a client who employs the licensed certified public accountant or firm to audit, examine, or report on any account, book, record, or statement of the client;
Any information that the licensed certified public accountant or firm, in rendering professional service, derives from:
A client who employs the licensed certified public accountant or firm; or
The material of the client.

section.section: A licensed certified public accountant or firm may disclose any data to another certified public accountant or firm that conducts a quality review.

The disclosure permitted by paragraph (1) of this subsection:
Does not waive the privilege required by subsection (b) of this section; and
Subjects a licensed certified public accountant or firm that conducts a quality review to the same duty of confidentiality applicable to the licensed certified public accountant or firm undergoing the quality review.

text.section:
The privilege against disclosure required by subsection (b) of this section does not affect:
The bankruptcy laws;
The criminal laws of the State; or
A regulatory proceeding by the State Board of Public Accountancy under §§ 2-317 and 2-412 of the Business Occupations and Professions Article.
